Why don't use Egroups to discuss about RPG????

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Good points. Let me try to answer.
> 
> Basically, we need to know where our storylines are going. Also, we 
> need to see what we can do to actually have more posts.
> 
> I agree that we could use a different forum, but we don't have 
access 
> to a board of our own. If anyone could help us for that, it would 
be 
> great. So, since in game posting slows down a lot during the 
> holidays, we thought that it might be a good thing to organize a 
RPG 
> discussion period at that time.
> 
> I hope this clears any uncertainties. If you have suggestions, feel 
> free to share them!
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "shadowess_azogoth" 
> <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:
> > Uh, I just got here. But if I have a vote, what are the issues to 
> be 
> > discussed?  Personally, I'd either post the issues and then go a 
> chat 
> > room or message board and discuss them, or something else.  
Posting 
> > seems slow as it is. But, that is just my opinion.  
> > 
> > Shadowess_Azogoth.
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > > 
> > > Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the 
> > > nbwrpg group:
> > > 
> > > In council discussions, we thought that 
> > > we might have a period of a week or two 
> > > when we would discuss only about the 
> > > rpg and where we want the action to go. 
> > > There would be no in game posts for 
> > > that period.
> > > PLEASE VOTE ONLY ONCE FOR EACH QUESTION
> > > Question 1: Do you approve for a 
> > > discussion period?
> > > Question 2: How long should that 
> > > question be?
> > > Question 3: When would that be? 
> > > 
> > >   o Yes, I approve the discussion 
> > >   o No, I do not approve 
> > >   o ***** 
> > >   o 1 week 
> > >   o 2 weeks 
> > >   o less than a week 
> > >   o more than 2 weeks 
> > >   o ***** 
> > >   o During the Holidays (starting December 26) 
> > >   o After the holidays (January 2) 
> > > 
> > > 
> > > To vote, please visit the following web page:
> > > 
> > > http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/surveys?id=1164433  
> > > 
> > > Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are 
> > > not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! 
> Groups 
> > > web site listed above.
> > > 
> > > Thanks!
